measured_by: Prosocial Effort Task (monetary benefit vs effort cost)
justification: “we measured willingness to help in two different contexts, one where the benefit was monetary and the cost was effort (prosocial effort)” indicates that the prosocial-effort construct was operationalised with a task manipulating monetary benefits against physical effort costs.

measured_by: Harm Aversion Task (financial cost to alleviate others’ pain)
justification: The same sentence continues: “and another where the cost was financial, and the benefit was alleviating pain (harm aversion),” showing that harm-aversion was assessed through a paradigm requiring participants to pay money to reduce others’ suffering.
